Title: Data Analyst / Data Visualisation
Description:
Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultant

Who We Are

NORRIQ is a leading international consulting firm headquartered in Denmark and Belgium, with 350+ consultants driving business transformation through technology. Our Financial Services practice includes 100+ specialists supporting banks, insurers, and financial institutions in navigating regulatory challenges, embracing emerging technologies, and meeting evolving client demands. We prioritize growth, innovation, and excellence, offering abundant opportunities for professional development and collaboration.

The Opportunity

NORRIQ is seeking to grow its Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence team with additional Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultants to improve the business performance of financial institutions. You will help our clients to optimize the value they can get from their internal and external data, through improved business performance monitoring and enhanced reporting quality and readability. Join us to work on impactful projects that shape the future of finance.

Responsibilities


Collecting and interpreting internal and external data about customer behaviour via the digital platforms (Web and mobile) and their digital transactions with the bank.
Translate data insight into actionable recommendations in order to coordinate the business needs around data and improve the bank‚Äôs digital and marketing strategy and optimize future campaigns.
Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations
Develop and maintain complex data models, databases, data warehouses and data marts .
Create data visualizations and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Perform data quality checks and ensure data integrity, develop and implement data governance policies and procedures
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data analysis and visualization


Your Profile


Master‚Äôs degree (or equivalent work experience) in mathematics or statistics, business intelligence, computer engineering, economy.
1-3 years of experience in data projects, preferably within the financial services industry.
Technical Expertise & Tooling: SQL (mandatory), SAS (nice to have), Python & R (to support our AI team), Reporting & Visualisation tools (Power BI, Tableau, Adobe Analytics, ...),.
ETL Processes: Affinity with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, including an understanding of data preparation, cleansing, and integration from multiple sources.
Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Business Analysis Skills: Experience in requirements gathering, process design and developing action plans.
AI knowledge: AI knowledge & interest to connect easily with our data scientist and machine learning engineers.
Communication & Collaboration: Excellent communication skills; ability to work well in cross-functional teams and engage effectively with stakeholders.
Languages: Fluent in English and native in French or Dutch.


What We Offer


Dynamic Work Environment: High-impact projects with leading financial institutions in a fast-growing consulting firm.
Career Development: Continuous learning and growth opportunities to advance your career.
Collaborative Culture: A supportive, innovative team environment that encourages new ideas and professional development.
Global Exposure: International experience working on cross-border projects that shape the financial services industry.


Why Join Us?

At NORRIQ, we are shaping the future of finance through transformation and innovation. If you're passionate about improving financial processes, driving change, and delivering value to clients, this is the perfect opportunity for you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you ready to step up as a Data Analyst and truly make a difference?

Do you have around 3 years of experience, but even more drive to grow? At darwind, we‚Äôre looking for people like you: professionals with some experience, but plenty of ambition to keep building their future.




Here, you don‚Äôt just get assigned to a project ‚Äì we work with you to shape your ideal career path based on your talents and aspirations.




What will you do?

You source data from diverse channels such as databases, surveys, and external datasets.
You ensure data accuracy and relevance by filtering and cleaning it.
You use statistical methods to analyze data and identify trends, patterns, and correlations.
You create reports and dashboards to present findings to stakeholders.
You develop graphs, charts, and infographics to visualize data insights.
You work with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide solutions.




Who are we looking for?

You have at least 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar analytical role.
You're fluent in SQL and comfortable scripting in Python or R.
You have hands-on experience with Power BI and/or Tableau ‚Äì from exploration to storytelling. You have in-depth knowledge of data modeling, relational databases, and ETL processes.
You're experienced in statistical analysis, including regression and advanced modeling (SPSS, SAS or similar).
You can clearly explain complex data topics to both technical teams and non-technical stakeholders.
You're fluent in Dutch, with good command of French and English.
You're curious, proactive, and passionate about solving complex data challenges.







What's in it for you?

Challenging projects tailored to your interests and expertise across industries.
A say in your career path, with coaching, training, and regular feedback.
An attractive salary package with hospitalization and group insurance, plus a mobility budget or company car with fuel card.
A flexible, hybrid work environment where autonomy is the norm.
A team that supports and inspires each other ‚Äì no egos, just impact.
The chance to work with data that actually gets used to drive decisions, not just reports that end up in someone‚Äôs inbox.




Ready for a fresh wind in your career? Apply today and let‚Äôs grow together!

Description:
üìä Vacature: Freelance Data Analyst




Wat?

Je analyseert complexe datasets en vertaalt deze naar heldere inzichten.
Je ontwikkelt dashboards en rapporten in Power BI en/of Tableau die stakeholders ondersteunen in hun beslissingen.
Je werkt nauw samen met collega‚Äôs uit verschillende teams om data-driven strategie√´n te ondersteunen.
Je optimaliseert datastromen en schrijft effici√´nte SQL-query‚Äôs om de juiste informatie boven te halen.




Wie ben jij?

Je hebt ervaring als Data Analyst of in een gelijkaardige functie.

Je hebt ervaring met Power BI en/of Tableau.
Je werkt zelfstandig, maar bent ook een teamplayer.
Je spreekt vlot Engels. Kennis van Nederlands en/of Frans is een plus.

Hybride werkmodel: een mooie balans tussen werken op kantoor (regio Zaventem) en van thuis uit.

Snelle opstart mogelijk ‚Äì we zoeken iemand die op korte termijn beschikbaar is.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
üöÄ Job Opening: Data Scientist / Analyst ‚Äì Dataiku Platform

üìç Location: Brussels

üíº Seniority: 3‚Äì5 years of experience




About ALTEN Belgium

ALTEN Belgium is a leading technology consulting and engineering company, specializing in Engineering, Life Sciences, and IT services. With a strong presence across various sectors, including automotive, pharmaceuticals, and finance, ALTEN Belgium leverages its expertise to deliver innovative solutions to clients throughout the country. As part of the global ALTEN Group, the company combines local knowledge with international experience to drive technological advancement and support clients in achieving their goals.




About the Role

At our clients company, data is at the heart of our transformation. Our Enterprise Data & Analytics function is evolving into a Center of Expertise (CoE), delivering advanced analytics, automation, and machine learning solutions.‚Äã




We are seeking a Data Scientist / Analyst with robust technical skills to engineer, optimize, and promote our Dataiku (DSS) platform, utilized by both expert and citizen data scientists. This role combines hands-on data science with platform optimization and support responsibilities.‚Äã

If you're a problem-solver passionate about transforming data into actionable insights and proficient in tools like Python, Git, Terraform, and AWS, this opportunity is for you.‚Äã




---------------------------------------------------------------------------------




üîß Key Responsibilities

Data Science & Platform Enablement

Design, build, and automate data workflows and analytics pipelines using Dataiku (DSS).‚Äã
Support internal teams and citizen data scientists in effective Dataiku utilization.‚Äã
Promote best practices in workflow structure, code quality, and governance.‚Äã

Platform Development & Automation

Manage and enhance our AWS-hosted Dataiku platform.‚Äã
Develop and maintain automation pipelines, integrations, and reusable components.‚Äã
Monitor and refine platform usability and performance.‚Äã

Cross-Team Collaboration

Collaborate with cloud, infrastructure, MLOps, and data governance teams.‚Äã
Assist in deploying ML pipelines into production alongside data science teams.‚Äã
Work with support teams to resolve issues and improve user experience.‚Äã

Documentation & Knowledge Sharing

Create comprehensive guides, documentation, and tutorials.‚Äã
Contribute to the development of an internal knowledge base on analytics and Dataiku usage.

‚Äã

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------




‚úÖQualifications

Must-Have

3+ years in data science, analytics, or data platform roles.
Hands-on experience with Dataiku DSS.
Proficient in Python, with working knowledge of Git and Terraform.
Good understanding of AWS infrastructure and cloud deployments.
Comfortable with automation, platform monitoring, and support.

Nice-to-Have

Experience with MLOps, DevOps, or ML pipeline deployment.
Familiarity with platform governance and performance tuning.
Exposure to enterprise data environments and integration work.

Soft Skills

Clear communicator across technical and non-technical teams.
Problem-solver with a proactive mindset.
Team player with a drive to learn and improve.




---------------------------------------------------------------------------------




üéì Education

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.‚Äã




---------------------------------------------------------------------------------




Why Join Us?

Be part of a transformative journey in data utilization.
Collaborate with top-tier data teams and contribute to scaling a modern data science platform.‚Äã
Gain exposure to a diverse ecosystem of tools, projects, and business domains.‚Äã
Combine technical expertise with cross-functional impact in a dynamic, inclusive culture.




üîí Please note: ALTEN Belgium is only considering candidates who do not currently require a work permit and will not require one in the future to work in Belgium.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst for one of our clients in the banking sector to support data-driven decision-making. The candidate will work closely with business units to gather, interpret, and translate data into insights that improve processes, support regulatory reporting, and inform strategic initiatives.







Responsibilities:




Collect, clean, and validate structured and unstructured data from internal and external sources.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and data visualisations to support business analysis and performance monitoring.
Work closely with business stakeholders to define reporting needs and translate them into technical requirements.
Perform data mining and statistical analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies.
Support regulatory and compliance reporting through accurate and timely data provision.
Collaborate with IT, risk, finance, and compliance teams to ensure alignment on data governance and quality standards.
Contribute to the development and documentation of data models and data dictionaries.
Assist in the implementation of data quality controls and data lineage tracking.







Profile:




Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Min 3 years of proven experience in a data analytics role, preferably within the banking or financial services sector.
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with data visualisation tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Qlik).
Experience with programming languages such as Python or R.
Solid understanding of data management principles, including data governance and data quality.
Experience working with large datasets and relational databases.
Strong analytical mindset with attention to detail.
Knowledge of banking products, financial regulations, or risk management is considered an asset.
Fluent in English and able to communicate professionally in Dutch.













About Dynafin Consulting




DynaFin Consulting is a human-sized, flexible consulting company delivering services in the Financial Services Industry. Our company consists of more than 160 committed consultants in several business domains: Invest ‚Äì Payments ‚Äì Credits ‚Äì Insurance ‚Äì Data - Risk & Compliance.

In 14 years, we have become a reference in the Belgian Financial Services landscape. In July 2017, we joined the Alan Allman Associates ecosystem, adding the international dimension to our ambitions.




What we offer :

- An attractive salary package (a competitive fixed salary with benefits: car (models in line with our "green fleet mobility" - net allowances - smartphone budget - full insurance & hospitalization insurances ‚Ä¶).

- The opportunity to optimize your work-life balance.

- A team of dynamic and passionate colleagues, recognized for their expertise.

- An excellent collaborative working environment: One Team & One Dream

Title: CRM Data Analyst
Description:
CRM Data Analyst, this is your challenge

Do you have a passion for data, insights, and coffee? Do you want to work together with energized teams towards the most performing plans for the Belux market? By joining our CX&I team, you will be in charge of customers insights, be the database guardian and also further optimize our analytics corner.

A day in the life of a CRM Data Analyst:


In charge of monthly B2C & B2B CRM reporting from basic KPIs to forecasting net acquisition.
Perform statistical analysis through different tools (Nespresso is working with Adobe, Knime, Snowflake, PowerBI) and present recommendations to the business.
Optimize analytical worklfows through automation and forecasting with pre-built data science tools.
Maintain DataHub knowledge & documentation, share best pratices and be the first point of contact locally.
Lead & implement the new Martech solution followed by continuous improvement in usage & roll-out.
Lead yearly deep dives across departments (collect requests, time & build & deliver analytics to stakeholders).
Adhoc analysis for internal departments (boutique, e-sales, trade, B2B), both re-actively and pro-actively.


Meet the team:

The Nespresso Marketing team consists of 17 persons operating in 4 distinct teams: Brand, Product, B2B and Customer experience & insights. You would be part of the later one which is a dynamic analytical team of 5 persons. The CX&I team collaborates with all the departments (Channels, Demand & supply, B2C,..) to nurture the company with insights thanks to Nespresso‚Äôs direct to consumer model. Our team is also the guardian of net acquisition and subscription on top of insights.

What will make you successful:


Degree in mathematics/statistics, or economic studies with large quantitative component.
More than 3 years of experience in data / analytics related activities in a business-oriented environment.
Understand SQL language & Snowflake (or having experience in coding).
Master OS office (Excel, Powerpoint, Word) and Power BI.
You have an open mindset and enjoy discovering new tools & approaches.
Knowledge about Adobe campaign and Adobe experience platform is a plus.
Fluent in Dutch and/or French AND English is mandatory.


Benefits:


A full-time position located in Brussels.
Hybrid working (2-3 days / week homeworking).
Excellent benefits, including an annual target bonus.
A variety of professional trainings and development programs.
Various career opportunities, both in Benelux and internationally.
Professional working environment, team spirit, company pride and passionate colleagues.
You will contribute to make Belux a better coffee place


Any questions?

Our recruiters would be glad to ask any pending questions. Feel free to send your questions to careers@be.nestle.com and you will receive an answer within 3 working days.

Applying for the role of CRM Data Analyst?

Great! If you see a match with the description as described above, we will gladly receive your cv and motivation. You can upload these via the link.

Please note

We use an Artificial Intelligence (AI) Tool to schedule interviews with our candidates. So keep an eye on your email for the interview invitation! When registering your application, you will be asked if we may send you whatsapp messages; if you answer 'yes' to this, you will receive communication via whatsapp in addition to messages via email. Communication through our AI tool is in English, but our recruiters speak Dutch, English, and French.

#Nespresso

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Freelance Data Analytical Engineer




Location: Mechelen (2 days/week on-site)

Contract Duration: Until End of Year

Client: Leading Belgian Telecom Company




The Context

Data is core to how this organization operates, not just as a backend function but as a strategic enabler across the business. The company is fully committed to data-driven decision-making, integrating analytics and AI directly into business processes and customer journeys. Their data organization works end-to-end ‚Äî from governance and architecture to experimentation and delivery ‚Äî with a clear focus on creating measurable value.




The Role

As a freelance Data Analyst, you'll be the vital link between business stakeholders and the technical teams delivering data solutions. You‚Äôll be responsible for shaping solution designs, defining data flows, and translating business questions into technical action plans. This is a hands-on role involving deep-dive data analysis, close collaboration with engineers, and responsibility for the functional integrity of data products.




Your Key Tasks

Collaborate with Data Product Managers and business stakeholders to gather data requirements and translate them into technical specifications
Design logical data models and map out full data flows aligned with business objectives and long-term platform strategy
Perform thorough data analyses, mapping source-to-target transformations and ensuring documentation is complete and accurate
Validate and challenge proposed designs in terms of scalability, cost-efficiency, and fit-for-purpose architecture
Guide the implementation with engineers, conducting intermediate reviews and providing technical support when needed
Define user acceptance tests and quality controls (including semantic validation)
Support incident resolution as third-line support, coordinating with engineers and product managers
Monitor the impact of application changes and ensure data products are updated accordingly




What You Bring

Deep knowledge of Snowflake and strong SQL capabilities
Experience with orchestration tools like Dagster, Airflow, or similar
Ability to communicate insights clearly and challenge assumptions constructively in stakeholder conversations
Strong analytical thinking and a natural problem-solver
Fluent in English; understanding of Dutch is a strong advantage

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Role Overview:


As a Data Analyst, you will analyze trade flow, execution performance, and market impact to detect inefficiencies and abnormal behaviors. You will work closely with Risk Management and Trading Engineers, leveraging data-driven insights to improve trading strategies, optimize system parameters, and prevent system exploitation. Your contributions will directly influence business operations making you an integral part of our success.


üöÄ What You‚Äôll Be Doing


  • Analyse Trade Behaviour: Detect toxic flow, arbitrage, HFT, scalping, sniping, and abnormal EA usage;
  • Optimise Execution Performance: Track order book, trade volume, fill ratios, liquidity depth, slippage, and requites;
  • Evaluate Liquidity Providers (LPs) and create data-driven dashboards;
  • Support Risk & Trading Teams: Generate reports on toxic trading patterns, latency, and spread control; optimize MT5, FIX API, and bridge settings for better execution;
  • Develop Risk Models & Alerts: Build rule-based or ML models to detect trading abnormalities, implement real-time alerts for irregular activity, and assess macro events and market impact.


üéØ What We‚Äôre Looking For


  • Generate Toxic Trading Pattern Reports within 24 hours of detection;
  • Improve Trade Surveillance Model accuracy by 30%;
  • Enhance order execution analysis to minimize system exploitation;
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a related field;
  • 3+ years of experience in data analysis;
  • Proficiency in Power BI, Tableau, or Looker;
  • Skilled in SQL and database management;
  • Knowledge of Python or R for in-depth analysis;
  • Experience in financial markets or the Forex industry (preferred).



üí° Why Join IUX?


‚úÖ Permanent Role & Career Growth: Join as an executive today, and you could be leading a department tomorrow! Many of our team members have grown from entry-level positions to management roles.

‚úÖ Premium Insurance Coverage: We take care of our people with comprehensive health coverage.

‚úÖ Flexi Benefits: Travel, medical checkups, dental care (including braces & scaling), or even your favorite gadgets ‚Äì we‚Äôve got you covered.

‚úÖ Laptop Provided: Plus, we cover maintenance costs ‚Äì and if you‚Äôre lucky, you might get an upgrade!

‚úÖ Global Team: Collaborate with colleagues from Asia, MENA, and Latin America, with Europe on the horizon. Want to be part of our expansion journey?

‚úÖ Work From Anywhere Arrangement: If you‚Äôre the right fit, we trust you to deliver ‚Äì from anywhere in the world.



Get to know us:


At IUX, we are more than just a brokerage firm ‚Äì we are a global fintech powerhouse originally from Cyprus, with a presence spanning Asia, MENA, and Latin America. As we continue to expand into Europe and beyond, we are seeking top talent to join our dynamic team. Our mission? To revolutionize the trading experience through cutting-edge technology, seamless execution, and a client-centric approach. If you‚Äôre looking for a fast-paced environment where innovation meets opportunity, IUX is the place for you!


All applications will be treated in strict confidence. By submitting your application, you consent to our privacy policy regarding the collection and use of your personal data. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Permanent Data Analyst




Location: Brussels (3 days per week onsite)

Languages: English & French

Seniority Level: 4+ years of experience

Reports to: Head of Analytics




About the Role

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our team. This role requires a strong technical background, the ability to work with complex data, and experience engaging with multiple stakeholders.




Key Responsibilities

Work within a feature team, analyzing large and complex datasets.
Write and optimize Python and SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze data.
Utilize ETL processes and work within Azure Databricks.
Collaborate closely with Data Engineers and other technical teams.
Interpret and translate business needs into actionable insights.
Engage with multiple stakeholders across different departments.
Ensure data accuracy and contribute to decision-making processes.




Requirements

4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, working with complex datasets.
Strong proficiency in Python, SQL, ETL, and Azure Databricks.
Ability to understand and dive into the technical aspect of data pipelines and code.
Experience working in large teams rather than small teams with a single analyst.
Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to explain technical insights in a business-friendly manner.
Retail industry experience or a strong affinity for customer-related data.
Fluency in English and French (spoken and written).




Nice-to-Have

Experience working with cloud platforms and modern data infrastructures.
Familiarity with customer analytics and behavioral data.




Interview Process

First stage: Interview with HR and CTO.
Second stage: Technical interview with team members.

Key Responsibilities

  • Work within a feature team, analyzing large and complex datasets.
  • Write and optimize Python and SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze data.
  • Utilize ETL processes and work within Azure Databricks.
  • Collaborate closely with Data Engineers and other technical teams.
  • Interpret and translate business needs into actionable insights.
  • Engage with multiple stakeholders across different departments.
  • Ensure data accuracy and contribute to decision-making processes.


Requirements

  • 4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, working with complex datasets.
  • Strong proficiency in Python, SQL, ETL, and Azure Databricks.
  • Ability to understand and dive into the technical aspect of data pipelines and code.
  • Experience working in large teams rather than small teams with a single analyst.
  • Strong stakeholder management skills, with the ability to explain technical insights in a business-friendly manner.
  • Retail industry experience or a strong affinity for customer-related data.
  • Fluency in English and French (spoken and written).


Nice-to-Have

  • Experience working with cloud platforms and modern data infrastructures.
  • Familiarity with customer analytics and behavioral data.


Interview Process

  1. First stage: Interview with HR and CTO.
  2. Second stage: Technical interview with team members.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My client based in Leuven who work in the Pharmaceutical sector are looking for a Data Analyst to work on multiple active projects. The selected consultant will be working with existing data, gathering it from various applications and transforming it into structured datasets that can be analysed and used for reporting and decision-making across the organization.

Key skills

Data gathering & cleansing experience
Data Analysis & Reporting experience
Advanced SQL
ETL & Data Modeling
English speaking

Logistics

Hybrid
Freelance
English Speaking

This role is a long-term freelance mission with a hybrid set up with only 2 day per week on-site required. We are hosting interviews for this position over the next two weeks so please get in touch if you are interested.

Description:

Nexeo Belgium is a consultancy company that supports its clients in the banking, finance and insurance sectors in all phases of their transformation projects: from business consulting to the implementation of IT solutions.¬†




As a consultant you will have the opportunity to be part of Nexeo:

International environment ( Offices in France, Belgium, Luxembourg, Switzerland & Canada)
+ 450 employees
over 20% growth each year




The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users.¬†

¬†

Understand the day-to-day issues that the bank faces
Performs cleansing of data quality issues through the analysi

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Function

Advisory - Advisor

Roles & Responsibilities

At KPMG, we believe in harnessing the power of data to drive better business decisions. Our team of consultants works alongside clients to help them transform raw data into actionable insights that fuel strategic growth. As a global leader in audit, tax, and advisory services, we combine deep industry expertise with cutting-edge technologies to deliver innovative solutions.

Role Overview

As a Business Intelligence (BI) Consultant, you will play a key role in helping our clients unlock the potential of their data. You will work on a variety of projects across different industries, focusing on improving decision-making processes, enhancing reporting capabilities, and developing data-driven strategies. You will collaborate closely with both internal teams and clients to ensure that data is collected, structured, and visualized in a way that drives value.

Key Responsibilities


Partner with clients to understand their data challenges and business objectives
Design and implement BI solutions, including dashboards and reports
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and optimize data models
Conduct data analysis to identify trends, anomalies, and insights
Provide recommendations to improve data management and reporting processes
Stay updated with the latest BI tools and technologies
Contribute to project management by ensuring timely and quality delivery


Location

Zaventem HQ

Skills & Qualifications


Strong experience in data analysis, reporting, and BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Qlik) Proficiency in SQL and data modeling techniques
Ability to translate complex data into clear and actionable insights
Good communication skills to interact effectively with clients and teams
A passion for problem-solving and a detail-oriented approach
Team player with a collaborative mindset
Willingness to learn and adapt to new challenges
A good communication knowledge of Dutch & English


We offer


A corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other‚Äôs beliefs and background.
Professional experiences in an international and dynamic working environment with inspiring colleagues.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working on different locations: home office, on-site or on the go.
A wide range of teambuilding activities and social events that enable new joiners to meet colleagues within the wider KPMG community and have some fun along the way.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Would you like to contribute as a data analyst to better consumer protection and to increasing public trust in the financial sector?




Come and join our FSMA team and become a data analyst at the ‚ÄòData analytics expertise centre‚Äô




WHERE WILL YOU BE WORKING?




The ‚ÄòData analytics expertise centre‚Äô occupies a key role in developing and rolling out data-driven supervision at the FSMA. As a data analyst, you will conduct project-based data analyses, provide advice and support for the implementation of innovative projects in various supervisory areas, and search for new data-driven applications that can support supervision.




WHAT WILL YOUR JOB ENTAIL?




You will be working on various innovative projects that help the different supervisory areas work in a data-driven manner.
You will be involved in conducting analyses as part of financial supervision, for which you will make use of external or internal data (MiFIR database, EMIR, textual data etc.).
You will assist the operational supervisory services in developing and implementing risk models and will thereby contribute to a risk-based approach to supervision.
You will search for new applications of data-driven supervision at the FSMA, and to this end will be in contact with various supervisory areas.




WHAT KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS DO YOU BRING?




A Master‚Äôs degree in a highly data-driven field (e.g. master in economics, business engineer, actuarial sciences, applied sciences, statistics or a similar discipline); a doctorate is an asset.
Preferably several years of professional experience as a data analyst or in the academic world.
Strong data processing skills and practical experience with R and/or Python.
Affinity and experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a plus.
An explicit interest in financial markets and products, as well as in the various new developments in those areas.
Strong adaptability and interpersonal skills. Ability to work on a team and to show initiative.
Strong analytical skills and a capacity for synthesis. Ability to communicate in a logical, structured manner both verbally and in writing.
Goal-orientedness, assertiveness and persuasive powers of argumentation.
Affinity with the tasks in the public interest entrusted to the FSMA.
Solid competence in Dutch and a good knowledge of French and English.




WHAT DO WE OFFER YOU?




A full-time job with a permanent contract.
The chance to do your bit for consumer protection.
A competitive salary package with many fringe benefits (e.g. group and hospitalization insurance, full reimbursement of the cost of commuting to/from work, budget-friendly company dining room, contribution to your mobile phone and internet subscriptions, additional non-statutory holidays, bank holidays, etc.).
A wide range of opportunities for learning and development.
Flexible working hours.
Good work/life balance (teleworking a few days a week).
Opportunities for internal mobility.
Offices within easy reach of Brussels city centre.




Please note that each member of the FSMA staff is subject to a strict code of ethics and is bound by the obligation of professional secrecy.

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Ben jij er klaar voor om als Data Analist echt het verschil te maken?

Heb je meer dan 3 jaar ervaring, maar nog meer zin om te groeien? Bij darwind zijn we op zoek naar mensen zoals jij: professionals met enige ervaring, maar met veel ambitie om aan hun toekomst te blijven bouwen.




Hier krijg je niet zomaar een project toegewezen - we werken met je samen om jouw ideale carri√®repad vorm te geven op basis van jouw talenten en ambities.




Wat ga je doen?

Je haalt gegevens uit verschillende kanalen, zoals databases, enqu√™tes en externe datasets.
Je zorgt ervoor dat gegevens accuraat en relevant zijn.
Je gebruikt statistische methoden om gegevens te analyseren en trends, patronen en correlaties te identificeren.
Je maakt rapporten en dashboards om bevindingen te presenteren aan belanghebbenden.
Je ontwikkelt grafieken, diagrammen en infographics om gegevens te visualiseren.
Je werkt samen met cross-functionele teams om hun databehoeften te begrijpen en oplossingen te bieden.




Wie zoeken we?

Je hebt minstens 3 jaar ervaring als Data Analist of in een gelijkaardige analytische rol.
Je spreekt vloeiend SQL en bent vlot in het schrijven van scripts in Python of R.
Je hebt hands-on ervaring met Power BI en/of Tableau - van exploratie tot storytelling.
Je hebt diepgaande kennis van datamodellering en ETL-processen.
Je beschikt over sterke analytische vaardigheden, een gestructureerde mindset en kritisch denkvermogen.
Je kunt complexe data duidelijk uitleggen aan zowel technische teams als niet-technische stakeholders.
Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands, met een goede kennis van Frans en Engels.
Je bent nieuwsgierig, proactief en gepassioneerd over het oplossen van complexe data-uitdagingen.




Wat zit er voor jou in?

Uitdagende projecten op maat van jouw interesses en expertise in verschillende sectoren.
Inspraak in je loopbaan, met coaching, training en regelmatige feedback.
Een aantrekkelijk salarispakket met hospitalisatie en groepsverzekering, plus een mobiliteitsbudget of bedrijfswagen met EU tankkaart.
Een flexibele, hybride werkomgeving waar autonomie de norm is.
Een team dat elkaar steunt en inspireert geen ego's, alleen impact.
De kans om te werken met gegevens die daadwerkelijk worden gebruikt om beslissingen te nemen, niet alleen rapporten die in iemands inbox belanden.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Quality Expert
Description:
Data Analyst / Data Quality Expert

Unleash your data Quality enthusiasm!




Do you have the supernatural ability to turn raw data into gold? Are you passionate about data and convinced that data quality is the key enabler for organizations to create value from their data? If so, brace yourself, because LACO has a data-driven adventure tailor-made for you! As our Data Analyst / Data Quality Expert, you'll be the Sherlock Holmes of numbers, deciphering business requirements like clues in a mystery novel. You'll be the architect of insights, sculpting data into strategies that steer the ship.




So step into the world of LACO, because we're not just your average Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company. We're the superheroes of many realms including Microsoft, SAS and Data Advisory, which earned us the rank of Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner. With a squad of over 120 consultants, we're on a mission to unravel the secrets of data and lead businesses from all walks of life through the digital wilderness. Join LACO, and you're not just an employee: you're family. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do, making every day at LACO a thrilling adventure.




YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst with focus on Quality at LACO, you‚Äôll be responsible for:




Gather and analyse data from different sources to identify inconsistency and trends.
Identifying data quality issues and clearly communicate their business impact
Clean the data and identify the route causes of data quality issues
Design and build data quality controls to support data stewards and other business stakeholders
Build (Power BI) data quality dashboards to monitor the overall data quality
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI, data quality frameworks and data platforms
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Troubleshooting and resolving data quality issues by identifying root causes and implementing solutions.
Staying up to date with the latest technologies and best practices to excel in this role.




YOUR SKILLS




You have a Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have good communication skills, used to work with business stakeholders.
You have an analytical mindset for analysing business requirements.
You have proven experience with data quality projects.
You have an extended experience with Business Glossary, Data Catalog, Data Lineage or Reporting Governance
You know all about the SQL
You have experience in Power BI, including DAX, data modeling techniques, minimum Star Schemas (Kimball) and others are nice to have.




You get even more bonus points if ‚Ä¶




You have a good Experience with master data management
You are familiar with data quality tool like Azure Purview (Collibra, Informatica, Soda)
Python, Spark, PySpark, Spark SQL
Other Security protocols like CLS (column Level Security, Object Level Security)
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.




OUR OFFER




Receive an attractive salary package, including a company car, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Get involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
Guided by our expert LACO coaches, you'll have the support and motivation to grow and build a sustainable career.
We practice participative management, as we extend a warm invitation to you to embrace ownership and play an active role in shaping both your future and that of LACO.
Have a say in which project placement you‚Äôll get, enabling you to work remotely, in the office, in a hybrid fashion, or based on your geographical preferences.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, ‚Ä¶




Don't let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our one and only Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success. Hurry up and smash that button, before your dream job becomes someone else's journey!

Title: Data Analyst / Data Consultant
Description:
Data Analyst / Data consultant

Are you interested in expanding your consulting exposure? Do you want to move away from an operations role and make an impact on the business?

Do you often feel like processes and ways of working could be better or more efficient?

Capco is a global management consultancy specialising in driving transformation across investment banking, securities services, and insurance.

We have the people, the vision, and the passion.

We are going through a significant growth journey, and now is a very good time to join us as we expand geographically, increase headcount and disrupt the consulting market across Central Europa with entrepreneurial and agile thinking.

In your role as a Consultant at Capco, you play a key role in the delivery of projects and gain wider exposure to our wider Investment Banking business.

You will work closely with senior clients to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading global banks.

Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.

We Are Looking For Talent With The Following


Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis


Skills & Expertise


Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the financial industry or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English


What We Offer You


The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals
An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture

HTML:
Data Analyst / Data consultant

Are you interested in expanding your consulting exposure? Do you want to move away from an operations role and make an impact on the business?

Do you often feel like processes and ways of working could be better or more efficient?

Capco is a global management consultancy specialising in driving transformation across investment banking, securities services, and insurance.

We have the people, the vision, and the passion.

We are going through a significant growth journey, and now is a very good time to join us as we expand geographically, increase headcount and disrupt the consulting market across Central Europa with entrepreneurial and agile thinking.

In your role as a Consultant at Capco, you play a key role in the delivery of projects and gain wider exposure to our wider Investment Banking business.

You will work closely with senior clients to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading global banks.

Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.

We Are Looking For Talent With The Following

  • Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
  • Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
  • Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
  • Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
  • Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
  • Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
  • Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis

Skills & Expertise

  • Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the financial industry or a consultancy firm
  • Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
  • Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
  • Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
  • Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
  • You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
  • Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English

What We Offer You

  • The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals
  • An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
  • Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
  • A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
  • A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
  • A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
  • A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
SII Belgium is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Big Data to join our team. As a Big Data Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing big data solutions to support business objectives. You will work with large, complex data sets and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to identify trends and insights. . You would join various teams working in the Energy, Retail, Banking or Telecom sectors.

SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a Great Workplace.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Key Responsibilities:


Develop and maintain big data solutions to support business objectives
Analyze and interpret large, complex data sets to identify trends and insights
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
Create and maintain data visualization and reporting tools to support decision-making
Integration‚ÄØbetween enterprise architecture and data collection.
Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies to identify new opportunities for data analysis


Qualifications:


You hold a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in IT.
Minimum of 3 years of experience working with data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive‚Ä¶
Strong analytical skills and experience using statistical techniques to interpret data
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French, and fluent in English.


We offer:


A challenging and varied role in a growing company
Opportunity to work with the latest technologies
Competitive salary and benefits
Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through training and education
Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group


If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
About the company:

As a total solution provider of medical devices and pharmaceutical packaging, Nipro Europe Group Companies is continuously committed to improving patient outcomes and quality of life. We are part of a large global network headed by Nipro Corporation Japan, an industry-leading healthcare company with over 38,000 employees worldwide. Our European headquarters in Mechelen, Belgium covers a wide geographical reach (Europe, Africa, India, the Americas) and is home to Nipro Medical EMEA, Nipro PharmaPackaging International, and the Institute for Medical Practice (iMEP) Belgium.




To accommodate our growth, Nipro EMEA is looking for a BI Analyst/Engineer who is dynamic, hands-on, and collaborative to join us in our Data Analytics team, based in our European headquarters office in Mechelen, Belgium.




About the role

You will be working in a team that designs, develops, and maintains data warehouses and data lakes. You will integrate various data sources, develop interactive dashboards, and analyse large datasets to provide valuable business insights.




What you‚Äôll do

Design, develop, and maintain data warehouses and data lakes.
Integrate various data sources ensuring accuracy and integrity.
Develop interactive dashboards and reports to visualize insights.
Analyse large datasets to identify trends and opportunities.
Collaborate with departments to understand data needs.
Document data processes and support data-related queries.




What you‚Äôll need

Bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science or related field.
5+ years of experience as a BI analyst/engineer.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication skills.
Knowledge of SQL and/or Python.
Experience with Azure, Snowflake, and PowerBI.
Hands-on mentality and proactive mindset.




Why you should apply

Join a global leader in healthcare with a commitment to improving patient outcomes.
Be part of a dynamic and growing team in a supportive work environment.
Opportunity to make a significant impact on data strategies and operations.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Career growth and development opportunities within a global network.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Votre mission

Join Partenamut, Belgium's first free, French-speaking mutual insurance company, and embark on a professional and personal journey where people are at the heart of everything. Here, we are ready to build the mutuality of tomorrow even more attentive and innovative. Every day, we support more than 1.3 million customers in proactively managing their health, but above all, we form a collaborative and supportive team. Your talents and individuality are freely expressed to achieve our common goals.

We believe in human-centred fulfilment, innovation, solidarity and diversity. If you're passionate about innovation and people, if you're prepared to go the extra mile for our customers while remaining whole, and if you like to challenge yourself at work while enjoying your free time, we look forward to meeting you so that together we can build the health and well-being of tomorrow.

Vos responsabilit√©s

As an experienced Data Analyst, you play a pivotal role in advancing our organization's data-driven initiatives by leveraging her/his proven expertise to provide actionable insights and support informed decision-making within business teams.

Daily:‚ÄØ


You support the business with their data requests, and structure findings into low maintenance and easy-to-read listings, tables or charts/dashboarding in line with the information needs of your customers and GDPR regulations.
You analyze data requirements by assessing data availability, quality, comprehension at project start to determine whether data is suitable for the need and how complex it is.
You support the data products owners with the data explorations.
Through a defined collaboration model, you support business in increasing data literacy : data comprehension, best practices for dashboard creation, data story-telling and best practices in data exploration.
You identify ways to increase adoption of the solutions you developed and stakeholder satisfaction.
You play an important role in the future implementation of the data catalogue by validating the accuracy and usefulness of the data. You are equally expected to provide feedback on how to improve the catalog.
You participate in delivery of projects and continuous improvement initiatives as part of cross functional squad.


Vos atouts

Your Profile As a Data Analyst


You have a Bachelor or Master in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or Information Management.‚ÄØ
You have proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst (minimum 5 years).
You have technical expertise regarding data models, database design development and data mining techniques.
You have knowledge and experience with databases (SQL, etc) and reporting packages (Tableau, Power BI etc). Programming in Python is a plus.‚ÄØ
You have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and present findings, disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.‚ÄØ
You have a strong work ethic and a skillset to juggle several different information requests with ease and composure.‚ÄØ
You are fluent in French and English (verbal & written).


Notre offre


A full-time open-ended contract with flexible working hours and the possibility of remote working up to 3 days a week.
An exciting position with real prospects in a fast-growing company.
In-depth training in the mutual insurance sector on arrival and regular training throughout your career.
An attractive salary with numerous non-statutory benefits that can be adapted to suit your needs.
Location : Brussels.
Up to 46 days of leave per year.
Please note that no application sent by an external consulting agency will be accepted unless the agency has been expressly authorized by Partenamut for this search.


Vous voulez participer au succ√®s de Partenamut ?

Click on "apply" to access our online application form.

Title: Data Analyst M/F
Description:
At LittleBigCode, a fast-growing and dynamic company, we push the boundaries of data and artificial intelligence to deliver cutting-edge solutions to today‚Äôs technological challenges. Our talented team is committed to innovation, knowledge sharing, and leveraging the power of data to drive meaningful insights and impactful decisions. If you're passionate about data analysis, business intelligence, and turning complex datasets into actionable strategies ‚Äî and want to play a key role in a pioneering team ‚Äî this opportunity is made for you.




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data analysis:




Collect, clean, and preprocess data from various sources to ensure data accuracy and reliability

Analyze datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that support business decisions

Create detailed reports and dashboards to visualize findings and communicate results effectively to stakeholders

Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA) to understand data distributions, outliers, and potential issues

Develop and maintain queries, scripts, and automation for data extraction and reporting purposes

Work closely with clients or internal teams to understand business objectives and translate them into actionable data insights

Perform statistical analysis to validate hypotheses and make data-driven recommendations

Support decision-making by providing actionable insights that inform business strategy and operations




Profile

You have a Master in Engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics) and you have at least 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst

You are comfortable working with both technical & business stakeholders, thanks to your nice communication skills

You are fully proficient in Data Visualization (PowerBI, Tableau) and SQL, Python is considered as a real +

You master the creation of dashboards & visualization solutions in order to bring business teams valuable & dynamic insights

You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)

Support Data Scientists & Data Engineers on deployment of AI applications

Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations

Fluent in English and Dutch and/or French

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Vacature Ervaren Data Analist




Geo Solutions is een Belgisch bedrijf dat organisaties helpt om de kracht van locatiedata ten volle te benutten. Wij ontwerpen en ontwikkelen slimme GEO-ICT oplossingen op maat. Onze innovatieve en flexibele dienstverlening ondersteunt klanten in de overheid, nutsbedrijven, industrie en constructie bij strategische en operationele beslissingen.




Waar je ons terugvindt? Wel, ons hoofdkantoor is gelegen in Edegem, maar we bieden ook flexplekken aan in onze hubs in Gent, Leuven en Namen. Daarnaast zal je ook op wekelijkse basis ter plaatse op je toegewezen project bij je klant werken.




Zo ziet jouw rol als Data Analist eruit:

Werkplek: bij je klant, Geo-kantoor/hub, thuis




Als Data Analist bij Geo Solutions maak je locatiedata inzichtelijk voor onze klanten. Een achtergrond in de brede wereld van geo is niet noodzakelijk, maar je hart mag wel een slagje sneller slaan bij het zien van X, Y en Z‚Äôs.




Een greep uit je takenpakket:

Je vertaalt businessnoden naar datavereisten, en je kan daar helder over communiceren.
Je voert diepgaande en kwalitatieve analyses uit op complexe datasets en zet de bevindingen om naar heldere rapporten.
Je schat het potentieel van use cases in door een eerste exploratieve screening. Daarbij zet je zowel een sceptische als opportunistische bril op.
Je volgt technologische ontwikkelingen op en deelt actief je kennis met interne en externe collega‚Äôs.




Jouw profiel:

Bachelor- of masterdiploma in IT of een wetenschappelijke richting
Minstens 5 jaar ervaring als data analist of een vergelijkbare rol
Sterk in Python met ervaring in (Geo)Pandas, NumPy, Folium, DuckDB, Polars, ‚Ä¶
Ervaren in SQL en ETL-processen
Vaardig met BI- tools (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, Superset) bij voorkeur met geografische data
Ervaring met big data (Hadoop, Spark, Databricks) en cloudplatformen (Azure, GCP, AWS)
Kennis van AI/ML (TensorFlow, Torch, Keras) is een plus
Vloeiend Nederlands en Engels zijn een evidentie




Dit krijg je van ons

In ruil voor je inzet en leergierigheid bieden we je een boeiende job met toffe collega‚Äôs. En dat in een bedrijfscultuur die persoonlijke ontwikkeling en vernieuwing sterk aanmoedigt.




Bij Geo Solutions mag je rekenen op:

Een aantrekkelijk salarispakket: een brutoloon (rekening houden met je ervaring en diploma), aangevuld met bedrijfswagen en tankkaart (of laadkaart), maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding.
Een gezonde werk-life balans: zo willen wij plezier binnen en buiten de werkuren motivering door flexibele werktijden aan te bieden
Aandacht voor nieuwe idee√´n: hier ben je geen nummer, wel een belangrijke aanwinst voor het team. We horen graag hoe jij bepaalde projecten ziet en hoe jij het zou aanpakken
Doorgroeimogelijkheden: we juichen met veel plezier je leergierigheid toe en bieden je toegang tot onze Geo Academy. Wil je graag een extra training volgen, een certificaat behalen of een externe opleiding volgen, dat kan allemaal!
State of the art technologie√´n: je bouwt ze niet alleen, je werkt er ook mee!




Kan je niet wachten om ons team te versterken? Stuur je cv en een korte motivatie naar jobs@geosolutions.be




Diversiteit, inclusie en gelijkheid

Bij ons draait het om mensen. We willen een plek zijn waar je jezelf kunt zijn, ongeacht wie je bent of hoe je in het leven staat. Verschillen maken ons sterker, en we geloven dat iedereen iets waardevols bijdraagt. Daarom zorgen we ervoor dat je je bij ons gerespecteerd voelt, en dat je met plezier je talenten kunt inzetten.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM‚ÄôS SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: ‚Ä¶ Some passionate colleagues üòÄ




WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Jean, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).




YOUR TASKS :

Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
Define the business specifications for BI needs
Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
Collaborate with the development team




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is also required
You are committed to travelling abroad occasionally upon the client‚Äôs request

Bonus

An experience in concepts: ETL, DWHSE, data & process mining, reporting‚Ä¶ could be a real asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you‚Äôre not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day
We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Show more

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Ben jij ge√Ønteresseerd in data en data-analyse? Heb jij een sterk analytisch vermogen en hou je ervan om zorgvuldig te werken? Wil jij jouw steentje bijdragen in het uitbouwen van infrastructuurprojecten? Dan ben jij misschien d√© data analist die wij bij het Departement Mobiliteit en Openbare Werken nodig hebben! We zijn op zoek naar een werkkracht die graag de schouders onder dataprojecten over wegenis, bruggen, tunnels, tramsporen, sluizen en kaaimuren wil zetten.




Jouw takenpakket

Je verzamelt, schoont op, verrijkt en structureert technische en economische data.
Je combineert technische en economische data om kengetallen en modellen te cre√´ren zodat infrastructuurprojecten sneller en accurater geraamd kunnen worden.
Je analyseert de data om opportuniteiten te zien en inzichten te verwerven vanuit het standpunt van de investeerder in openbare infrastructuur.
Je visualiseert de data door middel van rapporten en dashboards.
Je publiceert rapporten en dashboards.
Je beheert rapporten en dashboards, zoals het monitoren van hun correct functioneren en van de nauwkeurigheid.




Je werkt onder meer samen met de celco√∂rdinator, de cost engineer, de Co√∂rdinator MEDIAAN, de business projectleiders van DMOW en de verschillende ICT-collega‚Äôs en -betrokkenen (ICT-chiefarchitect, informatici, ICT-projectleiders, DPO, dataspecialist, GIS-specialist). De focus zal hier voornamelijk op het verzamelen, verwerken, analyseren en visualiseren van economische en technische data liggen. Zo word je betrokken bij verschillende infrastructuurprojecten zoals het aanleggen of vernieuwen van wegenis, bruggen, tunnels, tramsporen, sluizen en kaaimuren.




Ben jij de data analist die we zoeken?

Je beschikt minstens over een bachelordiploma.
Je hebt minstens 5 jaar ervaring als data analyst, reporting analyst of data scientist. Je hebt praktische ervaring met gebruik van Microsoft-applicaties en -platformen, zoals Excel en Power BI, om data te bewerken, te analyseren en te visualiseren.
Je beschikt over uitstekende praktische ICT-vaardigheden.
Je gaat vlot om met digitale toepassingen (o.a. webapplicaties).
Je kan goed aan de slag met de applicaties van Microsoft Office 365.
Je hebt goede kritische analytische vaardigheden en je bent nieuwsgierig en toegewijd om problemen op te lossen en verbanden te leggen of oorzaken te zien.
Je hebt een sterke wiskundige basis (statistiek, modellering) en interesse in data-analyse en modellering.
Je hebt een zeer goede kennis van het Nederlands.

Pluspunten

Je hebt kennis van R en/of Python of basiskennis van Matlab, VB.NET of aanverwante software)




Werken via Vlaanderen Connect

Je wordt tewerkgesteld via Vlaanderen Connect, de ICT strategische dienstverlener van de Vlaamse overheid. Bij Vlaanderen Connect. wordt je voor onbepaalde duur ter beschikking gesteld aan het Departement Mobiliteit en Openbare werken, hierbij ontvang je een contract van onbepaalde duur.

Werken voor Vlaanderen Connect. betekent werken in een organisatie met boeiende en uitdagende IT functies √©n de mogelijkheid om mee je schouders te zetten in het uitbouwen van een digitaal en slagkrachtig Vlaanderen.




Verder biedt werken voor Vlaanderen Connect tal van voordelen. Je werkt bij entiteiten van de Vlaamse overheid of bij lokale besturen voor lange termijn. Zo kan je meewerken aan een digitale en slagkrachtige overheid, voor burgers en ondernemers. Daarnaast kan je doorgroeien en jezelf ontwikkelen door het enorme potentieel aan uitdagende functies via Vlaanderen Connect bij de Vlaamse overheid en de lokale besturen.




Aanbod

Vlaanderen connect biedt een contract van onbepaalde duur en een competitief salarispakket met:

een mobiliteitsbudget
maaltijdcheques van 8 euro/dag (eigen bijdrage 1,09 euro/dag)
een hospitalisatieverzekering (je kan gezinsleden aansluiten)
een groepsverzekering
mogelijkheid tot kinderopvang tijdens alle schoolvakanties aan een voordelig tarief.




Bij Vlaanderen connect is een gezonde balans tussen werk en priv√© belangrijk: een werkweek van 38 uur, 28 dagen verlof en extra wettelijke feestdagen (11/07, 02/11, 15/11 en 26/12). Verder zijn er flexibele werkuren en je kan thuiswerken.




Ten slotte krijg je bij Vlaanderen connect nog verschillende andere voordelen: je werkt bij entiteiten van de Vlaamse overheid of bij lokale besturen voor lange termijn. Zo kan je kan je doorgroeien en jezelf ontwikkelen door het enorme potentieel aan uitdagende functies via Vlaanderen connect bij de Vlaamse overheid en de lokale besturen.




Nieuwsgierig?

Bekijk de volledige vacature op https://www.vlaanderen.be/werken-voor-vlaanderen/vacatures/data-analist-dmow-via-vlaanderen-connect-d36980. Neem zeker eens een kijkje in het selectiereglement waarin een praktisch voorbeeld staat uitgeschreven en wat jouw rol als data analist kan zijn.




Overtuigd?!

Solliciteren kan via de sollicitatieknop!

  • een groepsverzekering
  • mogelijkheid tot kinderopvang tijdens alle schoolvakanties aan een voordelig tarief.


Bij Vlaanderen connect is een gezonde balans tussen werk en priv√© belangrijk: een werkweek van 38 uur, 28 dagen verlof en extra wettelijke feestdagen (11/07, 02/11, 15/11 en 26/12). Verder zijn er flexibele werkuren en je kan thuiswerken.


Ten slotte krijg je bij Vlaanderen connect nog verschillende andere voordelen: je werkt bij entiteiten van de Vlaamse overheid of bij lokale besturen voor lange termijn. Zo kan je kan je doorgroeien en jezelf ontwikkelen door het enorme potentieel aan uitdagende functies via Vlaanderen connect bij de Vlaamse overheid en de lokale besturen.


Nieuwsgierig?

Bekijk de volledige vacature op https://www.vlaanderen.be/werken-voor-vlaanderen/vacatures/data-analist-dmow-via-vlaanderen-connect-d36980. Neem zeker eens een kijkje in het selectiereglement waarin een praktisch voorbeeld staat uitgeschreven en wat jouw rol als data analist kan zijn.


Overtuigd?!

Solliciteren kan via de sollicitatieknop!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
BI Engineer/Analyst Data & Reporting




We are searching for an analyst that will be dedicated for the Data & Reporting team. He will be focussing on the data flow to be delivered through a unique data and lakehouse and to prepare this for new usages such as enterprise data (BI) and AI.

Our approach is Agile, so we work together faster and smarter. There is plenty of room for initiative, and we achieve visible results together in a challenging context.




What is your impact as a BI Engineer/Analyst at NN?

As a BI engineer/analyst, you collect and analyse business requirements and needs in order to arrive at a fully functional analysis. You play a crucial role in transforming raw data into actionable insights.

You have an understanding of the (life) insurance industry
You align with business stakeholders in order to refine their requirements and check feasibility, completeness and coherence
You document, adapt, or validate the business rules and their calculation
You collaborate with the data engineer who designs the ETL pipeline that meets your needs.
You design and maintain the different data models used for reporting
You create the domain driven datamarts to allow the business to do their own reporting
You do a regular follow up on all the existing datamarts in production
You abide by the existing data architecture and challenge it whenever possible
You can automate data processes and derive the right conclusions




What do you have to offer as BI Engineer/Analyst?

Demonstrable experience as a BI Engineer/analyst
Data modelling & data mapping (be able to consolidate different source systems in order to create the correct insights
Knowledge of Domain Driven Design principles and patterns is a must
Queries on database (SQL)
A strong knowledge of English. A knowledge of Dutch or French is an additional asset
Strong analytical skills: a critical, problem-solving and proactive mindset with a 'hands-on' approach
Knowledge of life insurance concepts, IFRS 17 & insurance accounting is an asset




Who are we looking for?

NN is looking for people who give their best, come up with fresh ideas and are willing to take the initiative. People who can live by our values: care, clear and commit. We believe in an open and inclusive culture, where everyone feels welcome, valued and respected. So be yourself above all!




What you get with NN

Your attractive salary package is supplemented by some attractive fringe benefits such as

group and hospitalisation insurance
meal and eco-vouchers
20 holiday days and 12 days recovery time




To discover your talents, develop them further and build on your career, you will receive

a diverse range of training courses
a comprehensive onboarding
workshops, coaching & well-being services
opportunities for internal mobility




At NN, we know how important it is to have a good work-life balance. That‚Äôs why we offer a flexible home working policy. To give your creativity an extra boost, you can, of course, always visit our new working environment in the bustling Brussels, easily accessible by public transport.

Title: Data Analyst(SAN817)
Description:
Job Description

Welcome to Sansaone, a dynamic force in the realm of ICT talent acquisition. Born out of a passion for excellence and a vision for connecting outstanding professionals with forward-thinking organizations, we stand as a beacon for strategic recruitment solutions in the Information and Communication Technology sector. With a commitment to excellence and a passion for connecting exceptional professionals with innovative organizations, we are your strategic partner in building transformative teams.


A Data Analyst is responsible for interpreting data, analyzing results, and providing ongoing reports to help organizations make data-driven decisions.
This role involves gathering, processing, and performing statistical analysis on large datasets to extract insights, support business objectives, and enhance operational efficiency. Responsibilities:
Gather data from various internal and external sources.
Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decisions.
Work closely with business units to understand their data needs and deliver insights accordingly.
Develop and implement procedures for data collection and storage.
Identify business issues and provide data-driven solutions. Technical Skills:
Microsoft Excel
Tableau
Power BI
QlikView
Python
MySQL
PostgreSQL


Hiring Team Member

Avula Srivalli

Recruitment Coordinator


LinkedIn
Mail

Title: Data Analyst - Data Kwaliteit
Description:
Wij zoeken een Data Analyst - Data Kwaliteit expert om ons Microsoft-team te versterken!




Over LACO

LACO is een Belgisch bedrijf dat gespecialiseerd is in business intelligence en data-analyse, met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring. Als Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner hebben we uitgebreide expertise op gebieden zoals Microsoft BI en Data Governance. Met meer dan 120 consultants helpen we bedrijven succesvol te zijn met data. Bij LACO combineren we toewijding met een vleugje plezier in alles wat we doen.




Bij ons staan langetermijnrelaties met klanten en collega‚Äôs centraal. Onlangs hebben we enkele grote projecten binnengehaald bij belangrijke klanten, en daarom willen we ons Microsoft-team versterken om samen met het LACO-team end-to-endprojecten te realiseren.




Heb jij de bovennatuurlijke gave om ruwe data om te zetten in goud? Ben je gepassioneerd door data en overtuigd dat datakwaliteit d√© sleutel is om organisaties waarde uit hun data te laten halen? Dan heeft LACO een data-gedreven avontuur op maat voor jou!

Als onze Data Analyst / Data Kwaliteit Expert ben jij de Sherlock Holmes van cijfers: je ontrafelt bedrijfsvereisten alsof het aanwijzingen in een mysterie zijn. Je bouwt niet alleen inzichten op, maar vormt ook strategische data-oplossingen die bedrijven naar succes leiden.




Jouw rol

Als Data Analyst / Data Kwaliteit Expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:

Verzamelen en analyseren van data uit verschillende bronnen om inconsistenties en trends te identificeren
Signaleren van datakwaliteitsproblemen en de impact ervan op de business
Schoonmaken van data en het achterhalen van de oorzaken van kwaliteitsproblemen
Ontwikkelen en implementeren van datakwaliteitscontroles
Opzetten van Power BI dashboards om datakwaliteit te monitoren
Samenwerken met stakeholders en verschillende teams rond data kwaliteit en dataplatformen
Ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI rapporten en dashboards volgens de behoeften van de business
Identificeren van oorzaken van datakwaliteitsproblemen en implementeren van oplossingen.
Op de hoogte blijven van de nieuwste technologie√´n en best practices binnen data-analyse en datakwaliteit




Jouw vaardigheden

Je hebt een bachelor- en/of masterdiploma in computerwetenschappen of een gelijkwaardige opleiding
Je bent communicatief sterk en gewend om met business stakeholders samen te werken
Je hebt een analytische mindset en kan business vereisten vertalen naar data-oplossingen
Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring met datakwaliteit projecten
Je hebt uitgebreide kennis van Business Glossary, Data Catalog, Data Lineage en Reporting Governance
Je hebt een sterke kennis van SQL
Je hebt ervaring met Power BI, inclusief DAX, datamodellering en Star Schemas (Kimball)




Bonuspunten als je ‚Ä¶

Ervaring hebt met Master Data Management.
Bekend bent met datakwaliteitstools zoals Azure Purview, Collibra, Informatica of Soda.
Kennis hebt van Python, Spark, PySpark, Spark SQL.
Ervaring met security protocollen zoals Column Level Security (CLS) en Object Level Security.




Ons aanbod

We werken graag samen met zowel werknemers als freelancers.
Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket en uitstekende extralegale voordelen.
Je krijgt toegang tot opleidingsmogelijkheden om je kennis te vergroten en je carri√®re verder te ontwikkelen.
Je werkt mee aan innovatieve Microsoft-trajecten die je uitdagen en inspireren.
Geniet van een geweldige bedrijfscultuur met ruimte voor leuke evenementen zoals familiedagen, jaarlijkse skireizen, sportevenementen, spelavonden, ‚Ä¶




Laat deze kans niet aan je datavingers voorbijgaan!

Neem contact op met onze recruiters en begin jouw avontuur naar succes.
