Title: Data Functional Analyst - POWER BI/ SQL/ T-SQL
HTML:
NTT DATA is actively looking for an experienced Data Analyst. This freelance position is based in Brussels.

Role

The Data analyst plays a key role in developing data solutions (data warehouses and data marts). He/she is in regular contact with the company to understand the business needs and translate them into data and technical requirements. He/she has sufficient practical expertise with the Microsoft SQL Server BI technology stack. This includes knowledge of Power BI and Azure databricks.

The Data Analyst is part of the Data Office, a central organization providing data services in the various business areas. He/she works within a Scum team in close collaboration with the Proxy Product Owner and the Data Architect of the project.

Responsibilities

Facilitate and conduct interviews with end-users in the business to determine functional and non-functional requirements for BI solutions;
Translate business needs into logical and physical data models with appropriate documentation;
Works with the data architect to translate requirements into functional and technical specifications;
Design, build, deploy and maintain BI solutions according to established standards (data integration, data warehouse, data marts) in accordance with functional and non-functional requirements (performance, data volume);
Test the analytical solution, troubleshoot, provide adequate maintenance and technical documentation;
Create visualizations and reports for requested projects in Power BI or SSRS;
Conduct prototype reviews and demonstrations including training on the data model for professional users;
Works with the Project Manager (PL) throughout the project lifecycle to ensure proper implementation in an agile and pragmatic approach.

Key competencies

Master's degree in computer science or equivalent;

Minimum of 7 years experience in functional data analysis and BI development in the Microsoft BI stack (including SSIS/SSAS);

Minimum of 7 years experience in data engineering with Azure Databricks, using Python;

Ability to translate business requirements into functional and technical specifications;

Strong experience in data modelling (logical and physical modelling);

Good experience in data warehouse design (Kimball dimensional modeling);

Very good knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server (from a development perspective), SQL queries, T-SQL;

Very good knowledge of Python, in a data engineering context;

Good understanding of database management systems, on-line analytical processing (OLAP) and the FTE framework;

Experience in visualization and reporting tools such as Microsoft Power BI and SSRS;

First experience in data management (Master Data Management) and data quality management is a plus;

Knowledge of the following tools is a plus: modeling tool (eg Enterprise Architect), Azure data analysis tools (Azure data factory, Databricks,...);

A first experience in working in agile project mode is a plus.

Language

Dutch, French and English

NTT Data, the 6th largest IT services company in the world. Is a trusted global innovator in IT and business services. We help our clients transform through consulting, industry solutions, business process services, IT modernization and managed services.

Title: Data analist & functioneel analist (Freelance)
HTML:
De Data Functional Analyst & BI Developer speelt een sleutelrol in de ontwikkeling van dataoplossingen (datawarehouses en data marts) voor de klant. Hij/zij staat regelmatig in contact met de Business om de zakelijke behoeften te begrijpen en deze te vertalen naar gegevens en technische vereisten. Hij/zij heeft voldoende hands-on expertise met de Microsoft SQL server BI technologie stack. Dit bevat onder andere kennis van Power BI en van Azure databricks.

De Data Functional Analyst & BI Developer maakt deel uit van de Data Office, een centrale organisatie die datadiensten levert binnen de verschillende NIHDI-bedrijfslijnen. Hij/zij werkt in een scrum team in nauwe samenwerking met de Proxy Product Owner en de Data Architect van het project.

Verantwoordelijkheden

  • Faciliteren en voeren van interviews met zakelijke eindgebruikers om functionele en niet-functionele vereisten voor BI-oplossingen te bepalen;
  • Zakelijke behoeften in logische en fysieke datamodellen met de juiste documentatie vertalen;
  • Samenwerken met de data architect om eisen te vertalen naar functionele en technische specificaties;
  • De BI-oplossingen volgens gevestigde normen (dataintegratie, datawarehouse, data marts) ontwerpen, bouwen, implementeren en onderhouden in overeenstemming met de functionele en niet-functionele vereisten (prestatie, datavolume);
  • De analyseoplossing testen, probleemoplossing uitvoeren en voor onderhoud en adequate technische documentatie documentatie zorgen;
  • Visualisaties en rapporten maken voor gevraagde projecten in Power BI of SSRS;
  • Prototype reviews en demos uitvoeren, inclusief training over het datamodel aan de zakelijke gebruikers;
  • Samenwerken met de Projectleider (PL) gedurende de gehele projectlevenscyclus om te zorgen voor een passende oplevering in een agile en pragmatische aanpak.


Key vaardigheden

  • Master in Computer Science of gelijkwaardig;
  • Minimaal 7 jaar ervaring in data functional analysis en BI development in de Microsoft BI stack (inclusief SSIS/SSAS);
  • Minimaal 7 jaar ervaring in data engineering met Azure Databricks, gebruikmakend van Python;
  • Vermogen om zakelijke vereisten te vertalen naar functionele en technische specificaties;
  • Sterke ervaring met datamodellering (logisch en fysiek modelleren);
  • Goede ervaring met het ontwerpen van datawarehouse (Kimball dimensionale modellering);
  • Zeer goede kennis van Microsoft SQL Server (vanuit een ontwikkelingsperspectief), SQL querys, T-SQL;
  • Zeer goede kennis van Python in een data engineering-context;
  • Goed begrip van database management systemen, online analytische verwerking (OLAP) en ETL framework;
  • Ervaring met visualisatie- en rapportagetools zoals Microsoft Power BI en SSRS;
  • Ervaring in Master Data Management en Data Quality Management is een plus;
  • Kennis van de volgende tools is een pluspunt: modelleringstool (bijv. Enterprise Architect), Azure data analytics tools (Azure data factory, Databricks,...);
  • Ervaring in het werken in een agile projectmodus is een plus.


Profiel

  • Sterk conceptueel denkvermogen en technische vaardigheden;
  • Proactief profiel, een echte doener;
  • Goede communicator (proactief, geen afwachtende houding, actief luisteren, duidelijk/precies/bondig);
  • Analytisch ingesteld met een pragmatische probleemoplossende houding;
  • Vermogen om relaties op te bouwen met business- en databelanghebbenden, vertrouwen en draagvlak cre√´ren;
  • Vermogen om zakelijke behoeften te vertalen naar werkbare oplossingen;
  • Teamspeler met de capaciteit om in een samenwerkingsgerichte geest binnen een transversale organisatie te werken;
  • Volhardend, stressbestendig en flexibel;
  • Leergierig en open-minded.
  • Kennis van Nederlands en Frans

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
afarax is looking for a freelance Data Engineer. We need you!




The project:

Our client in the utilities sector is looking for a Data Engineer to join their team.




Tasks:

We are looking for Data Engineers able to create data pipelines, efficient storage structures, powerful materialized views in different analytical technologies, but also data exchange endpoints at destination of our users. To some extent, you‚Äôll also have to interact with aspect related to governance tools (Glossary, Modeling, Lineage, or Data Quality‚Ä¶).




What you will NOT be doing

You shall not act from an Ivory Technical Tower.
You don‚Äôt not make decisions for the Business but rather advise them with careful logic or showing your reasoning.
You shall not deliver technical solution, rather product features.




Is this you?

At least 3 years‚Äô experience in a similar role
Usage of the SQL server
Implementing data pipelines using Azure services such as Azure Databricks, but also to some extent Azure Data Factory, Azure Functions, Azure Stream/log Analytics, and Azure DevOps
Implementing data pipelines or data enrichments with Python in a Databricks environment
Language skills: fluent in English (must have) AND fluent in German/French or Dutch (soft requirement)
Open to learn and jump on new technologies (on the ones listed above, or also Redis, RabbitMQ, Neo4j, or Apache Arrow, ‚Ä¶)
Able and willing to interact with business analysts and stakeholders to refine some requirements and to present reusable and integrated solution
Able and willing to contribute to extensive testing of the solution, as the reinforcement of devops principles within the team.
Able and willing to contribute to the writing and structuration of documentation
Experience with PowerBI
Able to challenge your interlocutors by leveraging your rational thinking, and no non-sense philosophy.
Continuously look at data in a transversal way (no siloes), across the entire Enterprise, to maximize coherence, reuse and adoption.
Track record of driving results through continuous improvement
Customer-oriented
Thinking Iterative
Analytical approach to problem-solving and a track record of driving results through continuous improvement
Team player breathing respect, open-mind, dare, challenge, innovation and one team/voice for the Customer
Product-oriented mindset
Enjoy sharing ideas with the team (or with other teams) and contribute to the product success
Good communication skills




How afarax supports you?

You benefit from our extensive network
You will have access to projects that fit your expertise
We help and support you throughout your project
We offer the possibility to build a valuable and lasting partnership

Check out more projects on: https://afarax.be/jobs/type/freelance/

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Expert - EU Institution (Belgium hybrid)
Description:
Who are we?




Trasys International is a dynamic global organization that takes pride in being the trusted partner of EU Institutions. With strong commitment to excellence and a 30-years track record of delivering high-quality solutions, we are dedicated to supporting the growth and success of our clients. Our Mission is to help our clients keep up with the challenges of digital transformation by providing the right talent at the right time for the right job. To this end, we are constantly looking for talented professionals who are interested in working on challenging international projects and able to deliver high-quality results within multicultural environments. Our services include (but are not limited to) modernization of solutions, digital workspaces, cloud technologies and IT security. Our Headquarters are in Brussels and we have active accounts and offices across Europe (i.e. Luxembourg, Amsterdam, Athens, Stockholm, Geneva).




Is this YOU?




For one of our main clients based in Brussels - an European Institution, we are looking for a Senior Business Intelligence Expert with expertise in data visualization, development (Java/Python/R/JS), and SQL to join our team in the area of digital-ready policy-making. You will be responsible for guiding the digital-ready policymaking team‚Äôs decisions on topics like the scope of the digital-ready support service or the evolution of the digital-ready policymaking community.




The position is hybrid based in Belgium where the office presence is need once/twice a week. If you‚Äôre not based in the area, relocation to Belgium (or borders) will be required.




More specifically, you will be responsible for...

‚Ä¢ Collecting information on digital-ready policymaking activities and needs from internal and external sources.

‚Ä¢ Digital-ready consultancy on new policy proposal / Building up the digital-ready policymaking consultancy service.

‚Ä¢ Analysing such data and visualize the findings to inform the digital-ready policymaking team‚Äôs decisions.

‚Ä¢ Streamlining regulatory reporting ‚Äì including its semantic aspect and potential for automation.

‚Ä¢ Supporting the implementation of the Interoperable Europe Act proposal including work with Member States.

‚Ä¢ Preparation of presentations, workshops, short reports on digital-ready policymaking.

‚Ä¢ Assistance with the management of ongoing activities to promote digital-ready policymaking.

‚Ä¢ Coordination and review of specific deliverables related to digital-ready policymaking.

‚Ä¢ Involvement in any AI-powered digital-ready policymaking pilot project.

‚Ä¢ Regular reporting to the project officer.




Are you the perfect match?

‚Ä¢ University degree (BSc/MSc);

‚Ä¢ Minimum 10 years of experience in ICT and data infrastructure.

‚Ä¢ Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience with several programming languages (Java, Python/R, JavaScript, HTML).

‚Ä¢ Minimum 5 years of professional experience with Data Modelling and SQL;

‚Ä¢ Minimum 5 years of professional experience with data visualization (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik), data handling (Talend Open Studio, Hadoop, FME), and data modelling (metadata management).

‚Ä¢ Preferably, some experience in digital-ready policymaking and AI.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Permanent position only




What is Cream all about?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company specialized in IT development and Business improvement. We are active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




Cream‚Äôs special recipe:

- 1/3 of Personal development

- 1/3 of Collective Intelligence

- 1/3 of Intrapreneurship




And Bonus ingredient: ‚Ä¶ Some passionate colleagues üòÄ




What is a Data Engineer at Cream?

As a Data Engineer at Cream, you can be in charge of the implementation of BI Business Projects or potentially coaching junior data engineers. As well, be responsible for the development of data ingestion and analytics solutions (data warehouses, data marts, etc.)




Your tasks :

Architecting Data Systems: Designing robust and scalable data models to meet business needs.
ETL Development: Creating or improving efficient Extract, Transform, Load processes to integrate and process data.
Performance Optimization: Monitoring and fine-tuning data pipelines and databases foR optimal speed and efficiency.
Data Security Implementation: Establishing data security measures to protect sensitive information and ensure compliance.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Working closely with data scientists, analysts, and other teams to understand data requirements and provide technical solutions.




How do we imagine our future consultant?

You have at least 2 years experience in data engineering
You have a Master‚Äôs degree, preferably in IT (Computer or industrial engineering) or in Business Administration or equivalent by experience (more than 5 years).
You are used to working with different data tools such as SSAS, SSIS, SSRS, AWS, Azure data factory, Apache Spark, SQL, Python, Tableau
You have a good database knowledge (SQL and NoSQL)
You are fluent in French or Dutch and have full professional capacity in English
You know what it means to work in an Agile mode
You are passionate about data, pay attention to details and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business




Why should you taste the lime flavor?

¬∑ A broad diversity of career options: you‚Äôre not stuck in a box

¬∑ You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues

¬∑ You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology

¬∑ You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company

¬∑ We have values we share, live with, experiment every day




We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE, CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What You'll Do:


Partner with commercial teams to create and deliver Client Business Reviews, including custom analyses, optimization recommendations, media plans and forecasts to improve performance and drive incremental revenue
Design, manage, analyze, and communicate results of controlled A/B tests
Create and share market trends and benchmarks to support in strategic planning
Collaborate with Product Analytics to execute on performance-improving initiatives
Influence the Product Roadmap by sharing client needs and feedback with our product and R&D teams
Leverage the partnership with our Global Client Operations Center to identify ways to improve efficiency in executing tasks through automation or delegation
Develop expertise on a key growth area of the business. Take ownership over knowledge sharing within the team and building client facing collateral
Troubleshoot campaign delivery and performance issues in time-sensitive, high-impact scenarios
Stay informed on industry trends and advancements in AdTech, analytics, forecasting, and attribution



Effectively communicate with teams and managers on project timelines and challenges

Who You Are:


Minimum 1 year of full-time, analytics-relevant experience
Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent practical experience
Ability to communicate in English and Portuguese fluently. Spanish is desirable.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to manipulate data sets to identify patterns and insights, and derive actionable strategies
Skilled in data storytelling and crafting impactful presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics, A/B testing, and experimental design
Proficiency in SQL, Python, and Tableau for automating analyses and creating compelling visualizations
Strong client and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to engage cross-functional teams
Comfortable with ambiguity; able to select the best solution from various analytics techniques
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and learning-forward environment
Proactive, organized and able to effectively prioritize tasks



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

  • Ability to communicate in English and Portuguese fluently. Spanish is desirable.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to manipulate data sets to identify patterns and insights, and derive actionable strategies
  • Skilled in data storytelling and crafting impactful presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics, A/B testing, and experimental design
  • Proficiency in SQL, Python, and Tableau for automating analyses and creating compelling visualizations
  • Strong client and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to engage cross-functional teams
  • Comfortable with ambiguity; able to select the best solution from various analytics techniques
  • Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and learning-forward environment
  • Proactive, organized and able to effectively prioritize tasks


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Risk Data Pipeline Analyst
Description:
Please submit your resume in English - we can only consider applications submitted in this language.Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
2 years of experience in program management.
Experience in working with data analytics tools and reporting platforms.
Experience with SQL.


Preferred qualifications:


2 years of experience in managing cross-functional or cross-team projects.
Experience with data, data architecture, modeling, trends analysis, statistics, and program evaluations.
Experience with data analysis using multiple scripting languages, tools, or platforms.
Experience with data analytics and extract, transform, and load (ETL) operations.
Experience with technology risk management and analysis.
Ability to create functional dashboards and visualizations to provide insights.


About the jobA problem isn‚Äôt truly solved until it‚Äôs solved for all. That‚Äôs why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you‚Äôll use your technical expertise to lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish. You‚Äôll work with stakeholders to plan requirements, identify risks, manage project schedules, and communicate clearly with cross-functional partners across the company. You're equally comfortable explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical tradeoffs in product development with engineers.

In this role, you will provide data sets, services, and infrastructure to help our business partners make sound, data-motivated decisions. You will lead technical projects to manage corporate data, enable data discovery and security, master and integrate disparate datasets, and deliver clean, secure platforms for reporting and advanced analytics.The Core team builds the technical foundation behind Google‚Äôs flagship products. We are owners and advocates for the underlying design elements, developer platforms, product components, and infrastructure at Google. These are the essential building blocks for excellent, safe, and coherent experiences for our users and drive the pace of innovation for every developer. We look across Google‚Äôs products to build central solutions, break down technical barriers and strengthen existing systems. As the Core team, we have a mandate and a unique opportunity to impact important technical decisions across the company.

Responsibilities


Partner with Risk analysts to identify, source, model, extract, transform, and load necessary risk identification process inputs (e.g., issues, incidents, assessments, measurements).
Design data pipeline integrity verification solutions and processes.
Propose and implement data governance strategies and mechanisms for ensuring quality data pipeline outputs.
Transform various input data sets into consistent data and risk models and document pipeline architecture and workflows.
Develop dashboards and provide insights to clients as part of engagements.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Title: Procurement Data Analyst II
Description:
About Nubank

Nu was born in 2013 with the mission to fight complexity to empower people in their daily lives by reinventing financial services. We are one of the world‚Äôs largest digital banking platforms, serving millions of customers across Brazil, Mexico, and Colombia.

Our Procurement team

Our purpose is to support, influence and challenge Nubank business decisions by delivering value to the end-to-end sourcing processes through long-term & sustainable partnerships, all executed with efficient, agile and innovative technologies.

The Procurement team's BHAG (Big Hairy Audacious Goal) is to be the best and least bureaucratic Procurement area in the technology segment by promoting cost efficiency through strategic long-term & sustainable partnerships with the highest skilled, diverse and engaged team.

You will be responsible for


Lead the creation and establishment of a comprehensive Procurement KPI tracking framework.
Proactively identify opportunities for process and efficiency improvements through data analysis and Procurement/BI tools.
Contribute to financial and Procurement data reporting, ensuring the delivery of reliable and timely information for various stakeholders.
Engage with stakeholders (such as Finance, FP&A, Engineering, Risk and other teams) across the organization to map data sources and ensure accurate data representation.
Develop and maintain datasets in BI and Data tools, enabling scalable data manipulation and analysis.
Design and implement dashboards to provide actionable insights and support decision-making for the Procurement team.
Utilize SQL and other programming languages (e.g., Python) to extract, manipulate, and analyze large datasets for optimized financial and procurement strategies.


We Are Looking For a Person Who Has


Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable business insights.
Proficiency in SQL, Scala and/or Python for data analysis and experience with data visualization tools
Excellent communication skills with the ability to influence and collaborate across teams as well as practical knowledge on documentation techniques, and project management tools.
Experience with financial technologies and a strong passion for business, economy, finance, and technology.
Understanding of financial statements and accounting data structure.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, and collaborative environment.
Familiarity with sourcing and procurement processes is a plus.
Language: Advanced proficiency in English; Spanish is a beneficial addition.


Our Benefits


Chance of earning equity at Nubank
Food/ Meal Card (Vale-Refei√ß√£o and/or Vale Alimenta√ß√£o)
Public Transportation Commuting Benefit (Vale-Transporte)
NuCare ‚Äì Psychological, Financial and Legal Assistance Program
Life Insurance
Medical Plan
Dental Plan
NuLanguage ‚Äì Language Course Program
Nucleo - Our learning platform of courses
Extended Parental Leave
Daycare Allowance
Parental Consultancy
Work-from-home Allowance
Gym Partnerships
30 days of paid vacation


Our Nu Way of Working

Our work model is hybrid and has cycles that can be from two to three months according to the business of expertise. For every eight or two weeks of remote work, one will be at the office.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Nu, we want to be sure that we're building a more diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects the customers we serve and seeks to empower. That's why we hire based on equality. We consider gender, ethnicity, race, religion, sexual orientation, and other identity markers as enriching elements to our company while ensuring neither of them represents a barrier when recruiting fantastic talent.

  • Contribute to financial and Procurement data reporting, ensuring the delivery of reliable and timely information for various stakeholders.
  • Engage with stakeholders (such as Finance, FP&A, Engineering, Risk and other teams) across the organization to map data sources and ensure accurate data representation.
  • Develop and maintain datasets in BI and Data tools, enabling scalable data manipulation and analysis.
  • Design and implement dashboards to provide actionable insights and support decision-making for the Procurement team.
  • Utilize SQL and other programming languages (e.g., Python) to extract, manipulate, and analyze large datasets for optimized financial and procurement strategies.

We Are Looking For a Person Who Has

  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable business insights.
  • Proficiency in SQL, Scala and/or Python for data analysis and experience with data visualization tools
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to influence and collaborate across teams as well as practical knowledge on documentation techniques, and project management tools.
  • Experience with financial technologies and a strong passion for business, economy, finance, and technology.
  • Understanding of financial statements and accounting data structure.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, and collaborative environment.
  • Familiarity with sourcing and procurement processes is a plus.
  • Language: Advanced proficiency in English; Spanish is a beneficial addition.

Our Benefits

  • Chance of earning equity at Nubank
  • Food/ Meal Card (Vale-Refei√ß√£o and/or Vale Alimenta√ß√£o)
  • Public Transportation Commuting Benefit (Vale-Transporte)
  • NuCare ‚Äì Psychological, Financial and Legal Assistance Program
  • Life Insurance
  • Medical Plan
  • Dental Plan
  • NuLanguage ‚Äì Language Course Program
  • Nucleo - Our learning platform of courses
  • Extended Parental Leave
  • Daycare Allowance
  • Parental Consultancy
  • Work-from-home Allowance
  • Gym Partnerships
  • 30 days of paid vacation

Our Nu Way of Working

Our work model is hybrid and has cycles that can be from two to three months according to the business of expertise. For every eight or two weeks of remote work, one will be at the office.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Nu, we want to be sure that we're building a more diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects the customers we serve and seeks to empower. That's why we hire based on equality. We consider gender, ethnicity, race, religion, sexual orientation, and other identity markers as enriching elements to our company while ensuring neither of them represents a barrier when recruiting fantastic talent.

Title: Marketing Data Analytics
Description:
ABOUT SHEIN

SHEIN is a global online fashion and lifestyle retailer, offering SHEIN branded apparel and products from global network of vendors, all at affordable prices. Headquartered in Singapore, SHEIN remains committed to making the beauty of fashion accessible to all, promoting its industry-leading, on demand production methodology, for a smarter, future-ready industry. Founded in 2012, SHEIN has more than 16,000 employees operating from offices around the world, and continues to expand operations globally. Join SHEIN and be the future!




CAREERS AT SHEIN

We Commit to Inclusion

We are committed to creating an inclusive work environment that enables us to tap into our diversity of strengths and unlock our collective potential through the work that we do. Employees benefit from working in a dynamic, global business that is leading the way in innovation by encouraging creativity and disruption to ensure that we are evolving the business for the better.




We Empower Talents with Diverse Careers

At SHEIN, we empower talent to excel with regular opportunities to elevate their career in their respective fields. As a dynamic business, we support internal mobility, diverse career pathways and recognition of success and contribution in a variety of meaningful ways.




We Engage with Global Cultures

SHEIN has over 20 offices worldwide , providing talent with many opportunities to collaborate with colleagues around the world. Perspective sharing and leveraging cultural differences, is one of our core strenghts as we work on many exciting projects and draw insights from industry-leading experience.







ABOUT THE ROLE

We are looking for a Fashion Analytics Specialist to join our team. This role involves using data to improve our performance in several key areas:




- Livestream: Develop strategies to improve GMV and UV during livestream events. Analyze performance metrics to refine and drive successful streaming experiences also crossing data with products and themes according to our audience.

- Pop-up Store Strategy: Work on initiatives to increase ROI and manage costs effectively within pop-up store projects. Utilize data-driven insights to maximize GMV and elevate customer needs and desires.

- Fashion Campaign Performance: Lead the analysis of fashion campaign performance, providing strategies to boost GMV and ROI while ensuring a captivating consumer experience with the campaign.

- Fashion Research: Maintain an up-to-date understanding of the fashion industry landscape by researching current trends, analyzing key data points, and applying insights to align with market demands and consumer preferences.

- Data Analysis and Trend Identification: Use data tools to understand market trends and customer behavior, turning insights into actionable strategies.







Join us and help shape the future of fashion with smart data solutions!







Qualifications:

- Fluent in English

- Experience in the fashion industry, with a focus on analytics and trend research.

- Experience in data analysis tools (such as Tableau) and methodologies.

- Ability to simplify complex data insights into effective strategies.

- Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate insights to cross-functional teams.

- Creative problem solver with a proactive approach.







At SHEIN, we believe that diversity is the force that drives innovation. We are committed to creating an environment where all voices are heard, valued and respected. All our vacancies are inclusive for people with disabilities, women, black people, LGBTQIAPN+ community and all types of diversity.

Title: Especialista em Analytics e BI
HTML:

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What You'll Do:


Partner with commercial teams to create and deliver Client Business Reviews, including custom analyses, optimization recommendations, media plans and forecasts to improve performance and drive incremental revenue
Design, manage, analyze, and communicate results of controlled A/B tests
Create and share market trends and benchmarks to support in strategic planning
Collaborate with Product Analytics to execute on performance-improving initiatives
Influence the Product Roadmap by sharing client needs and feedback with our product and R&D teams
Leverage the partnership with our Global Client Operations Center to identify ways to improve efficiency in executing tasks through automation or delegation
Develop expertise on a key growth area of the business. Take ownership over knowledge sharing within the team and building client facing collateral
Troubleshoot campaign delivery and performance issues in time-sensitive, high-impact scenarios
Stay informed on industry trends and advancements in AdTech, analytics, forecasting, and attribution



Effectively communicate with teams and managers on project timelines and challenges

Who You Are:


Minimum 1 year of full-time, analytics-relevant experience
Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent practical experience
Ability to communicate in English and Portuguese fluently. Spanish is desirable.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to manipulate data sets to identify patterns and insights, and derive actionable strategies
Skilled in data storytelling and crafting impactful presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics, A/B testing, and experimental design
Proficiency in SQL, Python, and Tableau for automating analyses and creating compelling visualizations
Strong client and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to engage cross-functional teams
Comfortable with ambiguity; able to select the best solution from various analytics techniques
Team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and learning-forward environment
Proactive, organized and able to effectively prioritize tasks



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Procurement Data Analyst II
Description:
About Nubank

Nu was born in 2013 with the mission to fight complexity to empower people in their daily lives by reinventing financial services. We are one of the world‚Äôs largest digital banking platforms, serving millions of customers across Brazil, Mexico, and Colombia.

Our Procurement team

Our purpose is to support, influence and challenge Nubank business decisions by delivering value to the end-to-end sourcing processes through long-term & sustainable partnerships, all executed with efficient, agile and innovative technologies.

The Procurement team's BHAG (Big Hairy Audacious Goal) is to be the best and least bureaucratic Procurement area in the technology segment by promoting cost efficiency through strategic long-term & sustainable partnerships with the highest skilled, diverse and engaged team.

You will be responsible for


Lead the creation and establishment of a comprehensive Procurement KPI tracking framework.
Proactively identify opportunities for process and efficiency improvements through data analysis and Procurement/BI tools.
Contribute to financial and Procurement data reporting, ensuring the delivery of reliable and timely information for various stakeholders.
Engage with stakeholders (such as Finance, FP&A, Engineering, Risk and other teams) across the organization to map data sources and ensure accurate data representation.
Develop and maintain datasets in BI and Data tools, enabling scalable data manipulation and analysis.
Design and implement dashboards to provide actionable insights and support decision-making for the Procurement team.
Utilize SQL and other programming languages (e.g., Python) to extract, manipulate, and analyze large datasets for optimized financial and procurement strategies.


We Are Looking For a Person Who Has


Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable business insights.
Proficiency in SQL, Scala and/or Python for data analysis and experience with data visualization tools
Excellent communication skills with the ability to influence and collaborate across teams as well as practical knowledge on documentation techniques, and project management tools.
Experience with financial technologies and a strong passion for business, economy, finance, and technology.
Understanding of financial statements and accounting data structure.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, and collaborative environment.
Familiarity with sourcing and procurement processes is a plus.
Language: Advanced proficiency in English; Spanish is a beneficial addition.


Our Benefits


Chance of earning equity at Nubank
Food/ Meal Card (Vale-Refei√ß√£o and/or Vale Alimenta√ß√£o)
Public Transportation Commuting Benefit (Vale-Transporte)
NuCare ‚Äì Psychological, Financial and Legal Assistance Program
Life Insurance
Medical Plan
Dental Plan
NuLanguage ‚Äì Language Course Program
Nucleo - Our learning platform of courses
Extended Parental Leave
Daycare Allowance
Parental Consultancy
Work-from-home Allowance
Gym Partnerships
30 days of paid vacation


Our Nu Way of Working

Our work model is hybrid and has cycles that can be from two to three months according to the business of expertise. For every eight or two weeks of remote work, one will be at the office.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Nu, we want to be sure that we're building a more diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects the customers we serve and seeks to empower. That's why we hire based on equality. We consider gender, ethnicity, race, religion, sexual orientation, and other identity markers as enriching elements to our company while ensuring neither of them represents a barrier when recruiting fantastic talent.

Title: Marketing Data Analytics
Description:
ABOUT SHEIN

SHEIN is a global online fashion and lifestyle retailer, offering SHEIN branded apparel and products from global network of vendors, all at affordable prices. Headquartered in Singapore, SHEIN remains committed to making the beauty of fashion accessible to all, promoting its industry-leading, on demand production methodology, for a smarter, future-ready industry. Founded in 2012, SHEIN has more than 16,000 employees operating from offices around the world, and continues to expand operations globally. Join SHEIN and be the future!




CAREERS AT SHEIN

We Commit to Inclusion

We are committed to creating an inclusive work environment that enables us to tap into our diversity of strengths and unlock our collective potential through the work that we do. Employees benefit from working in a dynamic, global business that is leading the way in innovation by encouraging creativity and disruption to ensure that we are evolving the business for the better.




We Empower Talents with Diverse Careers

At SHEIN, we empower talent to excel with regular opportunities to elevate their career in their respective fields. As a dynamic business, we support internal mobility, diverse career pathways and recognition of success and contribution in a variety of meaningful ways.




We Engage with Global Cultures

SHEIN has over 20 offices worldwide , providing talent with many opportunities to collaborate with colleagues around the world. Perspective sharing and leveraging cultural differences, is one of our core strenghts as we work on many exciting projects and draw insights from industry-leading experience.







ABOUT THE ROLE

We are looking for a Fashion Analytics Specialist to join our team. This role involves using data to improve our performance in several key areas:




- Livestream: Develop strategies to improve GMV and UV during livestream events. Analyze performance metrics to refine and drive successful streaming experiences also crossing data with products and themes according to our audience.

- Pop-up Store Strategy: Work on initiatives to increase ROI and manage costs effectively within pop-up store projects. Utilize data-driven insights to maximize GMV and elevate customer needs and desires.

- Fashion Campaign Performance: Lead the analysis of fashion campaign performance, providing strategies to boost GMV and ROI while ensuring a captivating consumer experience with the campaign.

- Fashion Research: Maintain an up-to-date understanding of the fashion industry landscape by researching current trends, analyzing key data points, and applying insights to align with market demands and consumer preferences.

- Data Analysis and Trend Identification: Use data tools to understand market trends and customer behavior, turning insights into actionable strategies.







Join us and help shape the future of fashion with smart data solutions!







Qualifications:

- Fluent in English

- Experience in the fashion industry, with a focus on analytics and trend research.

- Experience in data analysis tools (such as Tableau) and methodologies.

- Ability to simplify complex data insights into effective strategies.

- Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate insights to cross-functional teams.

- Creative problem solver with a proactive approach.







At SHEIN, we believe that diversity is the force that drives innovation. We are committed to creating an environment where all voices are heard, valued and respected. All our vacancies are inclusive for people with disabilities, women, black people, LGBTQIAPN+ community and all types of diversity.

Founded in 2012, SHEIN has more than 16,000 employees operating from offices around the world, and continues to expand operations globally. Join SHEIN and be the future!


CAREERS AT SHEIN

We Commit to Inclusion

We are committed to creating an inclusive work environment that enables us to tap into our diversity of strengths and unlock our collective potential through the work that we do. Employees benefit from working in a dynamic, global business that is leading the way in innovation by encouraging creativity and disruption to ensure that we are evolving the business for the better.


We Empower Talents with Diverse Careers

At SHEIN, we empower talent to excel with regular opportunities to elevate their career in their respective fields. As a dynamic business, we support internal mobility, diverse career pathways and recognition of success and contribution in a variety of meaningful ways.


We Engage with Global Cultures

SHEIN has over 20 offices worldwide , providing talent with many opportunities to collaborate with colleagues around the world. Perspective sharing and leveraging cultural differences, is one of our core strenghts as we work on many exciting projects and draw insights from industry-leading experience.



ABOUT THE ROLE

We are looking for a Fashion Analytics Specialist to join our team. This role involves using data to improve our performance in several key areas:


- Livestream: Develop strategies to improve GMV and UV during livestream events. Analyze performance metrics to refine and drive successful streaming experiences also crossing data with products and themes according to our audience.

- Pop-up Store Strategy: Work on initiatives to increase ROI and manage costs effectively within pop-up store projects. Utilize data-driven insights to maximize GMV and elevate customer needs and desires.

- Fashion Campaign Performance: Lead the analysis of fashion campaign performance, providing strategies to boost GMV and ROI while ensuring a captivating consumer experience with the campaign.

- Fashion Research: Maintain an up-to-date understanding of the fashion industry landscape by researching current trends, analyzing key data points, and applying insights to align with market demands and consumer preferences.

- Data Analysis and Trend Identification: Use data tools to understand market trends and customer behavior, turning insights into actionable strategies.



Join us and help shape the future of fashion with smart data solutions!



Qualifications:

- Fluent in English

- Experience in the fashion industry, with a focus on analytics and trend research.

- Experience in data analysis tools (such as Tableau) and methodologies.

- Ability to simplify complex data insights into effective strategies.

- Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate insights to cross-functional teams.

- Creative problem solver with a proactive approach.



At SHEIN, we believe that diversity is the force that drives innovation. We are committed to creating an environment where all voices are heard, valued and respected. All our vacancies are inclusive for people with disabilities, women, black people, LGBTQIAPN+ community and all types of diversity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Ebury is a leading global fintech company that empowers businesses to trade and grow internationally. It offers a comprehensive suite of products, including international payments and collections, FX risk management, trade finance, and API integrations. Founded in 2009 by Juan Lobato and Salvador Garc√≠a, Ebury is one of the fastest-growing global fintechs, with over 1,700 employees and 38 offices in more than 25 countries.

Ebury is looking to hire a Commercial Analyst to be based in our Sao Paulo office, working with our LATAM commercial teams.

You will join the Sales Acceleration team and help to develop innovative, data-driven processes,tools and dashboards that support the commercial team in growing revenues and improving the client experience.

We are looking for a candidate that is comfortable with data and logical thinking, but crucially, is also able to summarise and communicate complex ideas to strong and outgoing personalities with confidence.

The Commercial Analyst will have a broad remit to help accelerate Ebury‚Äôs growth. They will have to deliver key projects across but not limited to;

Key Responsibilities


Partnering with the commercial leadership to drive insights on team performance and revenue strategy
Supporting the expansion of Ebury‚Äôs data toolkit: transforming our data and sharing insights to commercial leadership on revenue generation, product utilisation, credit offering, front office activity and more
Overseeing KPIs and funnel management for the Brazil, Mexico and Chile offices (with potential for expansion)
Thinking about tomorrow: experimenting with what we can build as new information sources, methods and visualisation tools become available
Consulting with the Front Office to ensure our tools fit their needs and requirements and are used beyond their release dates


Skillset


Confident at summarising and communicating data insight to sales teams
Knowledge and practical experience of SQL is desirable
Able to transform complex data sets and prioritise the developed insights into clear, structured and actionable ‚Äòso what‚Äô messages
Experience with data visualisation and cloud data visualisation platforms such as Google Data Studio/Tableau/Looker/
The candidate may also have proficiency in spreadsheet applications such as Excel/Google Sheets (e.g. multiple formulae, charting, pivot tables, macros)


Who We Are Looking For


Experience in finance, fintech, consulting or similar with an understanding of financial markets and products
A candidate with a commercial and creative mindset, coupled with an interest in data analysis, transformation and presentation
A lateral thinker able to approach challenges with an open mind and be comfortable in not immediately knowing the answer, or even which technique to use to solve the problem
Business/Marketing/Economics degree background-lingual
Multi-lingual with Portuguese + English required, Spanish desired.


About Us

Ebury is a FinTech success story, positioned among the fastest-growing international companies in its sector.

Founded in 2009, we are headquartered in London and have more than 1700 staff with a presence in more than 25 countries worldwide. Cultural diversity is part of what makes Ebury a special place to be. From Sao Paulo to Dubai, Bucharest to Toronto, we enjoy sharing team experiences and celebrating success across the Ebury family.

Hard work pays off: in 2019, Ebury received a ¬£350 million investment from Banco Santander and has won internationally recognised awards including Financial Times: 1000 Europe's Fastest-Growing Companies.

None of this would have been possible without our proudest achievement: our great people. Enthusiastic, innovative and collaborative teams, always ready to disrupt and revolutionise the fast-paced FinTech sector.

We believe in inclusion. We stand against discrimination in all forms and have no tolerance for the intolerance of differences that makes us a modern and successful organisation. At Ebury, you can be whoever you want to be and still feel a sense of belonging no matter your story because we want you and your uniqueness to help write our future.

Please submit your application on the careers website directly, uploading your CV / resume in English.

  • Experience in finance, fintech, consulting or similar with an understanding of financial markets and products
  • A candidate with a commercial and creative mindset, coupled with an interest in data analysis, transformation and presentation
  • A lateral thinker able to approach challenges with an open mind and be comfortable in not immediately knowing the answer, or even which technique to use to solve the problem
  • Business/Marketing/Economics degree background-lingual
  • Multi-lingual with Portuguese + English required, Spanish desired.

About Us

Ebury is a FinTech success story, positioned among the fastest-growing international companies in its sector.

Founded in 2009, we are headquartered in London and have more than 1700 staff with a presence in more than 25 countries worldwide. Cultural diversity is part of what makes Ebury a special place to be. From Sao Paulo to Dubai, Bucharest to Toronto, we enjoy sharing team experiences and celebrating success across the Ebury family.

Hard work pays off: in 2019, Ebury received a ¬£350 million investment from Banco Santander and has won internationally recognised awards including Financial Times: 1000 Europe's Fastest-Growing Companies.

None of this would have been possible without our proudest achievement: our great people. Enthusiastic, innovative and collaborative teams, always ready to disrupt and revolutionise the fast-paced FinTech sector.

We believe in inclusion. We stand against discrimination in all forms and have no tolerance for the intolerance of differences that makes us a modern and successful organisation. At Ebury, you can be whoever you want to be and still feel a sense of belonging no matter your story because we want you and your uniqueness to help write our future.
